name: DeletePerson
description:
Delete an individual person from a project.

This tool deletes a specific person from a given project. Use it when you need to remove an individual person. For deleting multiple persons at once, consider using a bulk deletion method.

parameters.name: person_id
parameters.description: A unique integer identifying the person to be deleted.

value_schema.description: A unique integer value identifying this person.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: The ID of the project to access. Retrieve by calling /api/projects/.

value_schema.description: Project ID of the project you're trying to access. To find the ID of the project, make a call to /api/projects/.

parameters.name: response_format
parameters.description: Specify the format of the response data. Choose between 'csv' or 'json'.

parameters.name: delete_events
parameters.description: Set to true to create a task to delete all events associated with this person, batched and executed at 5AM UTC every Sunday.

value_schema.description: If true, a task to delete all events associated with this person will be created and queued. The task does not run immediately and instead is batched together and at 5AM UTC every Sunday

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the PostHog API.

parameters.name: delete_events
parameters.description: If true, a task to delete all events associated with this person will be created and queued. The task does not run immediately and instead is batched together and at 5AM UTC every Sunday

value_schema.description: If true, a task to delete all events associated with this person will be created and queued. The task does not run immediately and instead is batched together and at 5AM UTC every Sunday

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A unique integer value identifying this person.

value_schema.description: A unique integer value identifying this person.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: Project ID of the project you're trying to access. To find the ID of the project, make a call to /api/projects/.

value_schema.description: Project ID of the project you're trying to access. To find the ID of the project, make a call to /api/projects/.
